## Public Member Functions

### EmitTargetCodeForMemcpy() {#a2ab4d3a4d8244caa1f031e2bba8089f9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SDValue WebAssemblySelectionDAGInfo::EmitTargetCodeForMemcpy (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> &amp; DAG, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdloc">SDLoc</a> &amp; dl, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Chain, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op1, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op2, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op3, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> Alignment, bool isVolatile, bool AlwaysInline, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> DstPtrInfo, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> SrcPtrInfo) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Emit target-specific code that performs a memcpy.

This can be used by targets to provide code sequences for cases that don&#39;t fit the target&#39;s parameters for simple loads/stores and can be more efficient than using a library call. This function can return a null <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> if the target declines to use custom code and a different lowering strategy should be used.

If AlwaysInline is true, the size is constant and the target should not emit any calls and is strongly encouraged to attempt to emit inline code even if it is beyond the usual threshold because this intrinsic is being expanded in a place where calls are not feasible (e.g. within the prologue for another call). If the target chooses to decline an AlwaysInline request here, legalize will resort to using simple loads and stores.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/webassembly/webassemblyselectiondaginfo-h/#l00028">28</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/webassembly/webassemblyselectiondaginfo-h">WebAssemblySelectionDAGInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/webassembly/webassemblyselectiondaginfo-cpp/#l00033">33</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/webassembly/webassemblyselectiondaginfo-cpp">WebAssemblySelectionDAGInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### EmitTargetCodeForMemmove() {#a9b816955c5f4ac7b656e1b0e9f8b8d8d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SDValue WebAssemblySelectionDAGInfo::EmitTargetCodeForMemmove (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> &amp; DAG, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdloc">SDLoc</a> &amp; dl, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Chain, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op1, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op2, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op3, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> Alignment, bool isVolatile, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> DstPtrInfo, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> SrcPtrInfo) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Emit target-specific code that performs a memmove.

This can be used by targets to provide code sequences for cases that don&#39;t fit the target&#39;s parameters for simple loads/stores and can be more efficient than using a library call. This function can return a null <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> if the target declines to use custom code and a different lowering strategy should be used.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/webassembly/webassemblyselectiondaginfo-h/#l00035">35</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/webassembly/webassemblyselectiondaginfo-h">WebAssemblySelectionDAGInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/webassembly/webassemblyselectiondaginfo-cpp/#l00052">52</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/webassembly/webassemblyselectiondaginfo-cpp">WebAssemblySelectionDAGInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### EmitTargetCodeForMemset() {#aac3adcbeebb403a2dfff0ca610d0d746}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SDValue WebAssemblySelectionDAGInfo::EmitTargetCodeForMemset (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag">SelectionDAG</a> &amp; DAG, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdloc">SDLoc</a> &amp; dl, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Chain, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op1, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op2, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Op3, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> Alignment, bool isVolatile, bool AlwaysInline, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/machinepointerinfo">MachinePointerInfo</a> DstPtrInfo) const</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Emit target-specific code that performs a memset.

This can be used by targets to provide code sequences for cases that don&#39;t fit the target&#39;s parameters for simple stores and can be more efficient than using a library call. This function can return a null <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> if the target declines to use custom code and a different lowering strategy should be used. Note that if AlwaysInline is true the function has to return a valid <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a>.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/webassembly/webassemblyselectiondaginfo-h/#l00040">40</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/webassembly/webassemblyselectiondaginfo-h">WebAssemblySelectionDAGInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/webassembly/webassemblyselectiondaginfo-cpp/#l00061">61</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/webassembly/webassemblyselectiondaginfo-cpp">WebAssemblySelectionDAGInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isTargetMemoryOpcode() {#ae7e0fe59c75c5881fbf9e853f1c5a8ae}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool WebAssemblySelectionDAGInfo::isTargetMemoryOpcode (unsigned Opcode) const"
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Returns true if a node with the given target-specific opcode has a memory operand.

Nodes with such opcodes can only be created with <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/selectiondag/#ae6cc63109335eefe2c5727d1e12fc820">SelectionDAG::getMemIntrinsicNode</a></code>.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/webassembly/webassemblyselectiondaginfo-h/#l00026">26</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/webassembly/webassemblyselectiondaginfo-h">WebAssemblySelectionDAGInfo.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/webassembly/webassemblyselectiondaginfo-cpp/#l00021">21</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/webassembly/webassemblyselectiondaginfo-cpp">WebAssemblySelectionDAGInfo.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
